quest.name: Environmental Unbalance
journal: The Allagan administrative node's warning lights are flashing.

The Allagan administrative node informs you that a large number of unidentified dragons have been detected nearby. These creatures pose a severe risk to the native fauna. It asks you to alleviate this risk by slaying four of the things.
You kill the beasts as instructed by the administrative node. Report your success to the system so that it may reevaluate the situation.

The administrative node indicates that although you have reduced the dragon population somewhat, their rate of reproduction is too high for this to be a viable long-term solution. The entire population of dragons must be eliminated to prevent further risk to the environment.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGSYSTEM
dialogue.text: Warning. Warning. Sensors indicate a large number of unidentified dragons in the immediate vicinity. These creatures present a significant threat to the balance of the local environment. Creatures are designated as Meracydian brobinyaks.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGSYSTEM
dialogue.text: All troops of the Allagan Empire, eliminate this threat. Each soldier is to exterminate four Meracydian brobinyaks.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGSYSTEM
dialogue.text: The nearby unregistered dragons present an extreme threat to the biodiversity of the local environment. Please destroy four Meracydian brobinyaks.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Elimination of unregistered life-forms confirmed. Verifying population of brobinyaks. <beep> <beep> Brobinyak reproduction rate significantly higher than initially anticipated. Environmental unbalance unavoidable without complete annihilation of dragon population.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGSYSTEM
dialogue.text: Unregistered life-forms are a direct violation of the Allagan Imperial Environmental Protection Act, the Pets and Domesticated Animals Preservation Statute, the Azys Lla Livestock Control Resolution, the Allagan Ecological Beautification Reform Treaty, the... <buzzzzzz>

obj.n: Close Encounters of the VIth Kind
